definition: to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])

sentences.english: If there is not add regard for the five ray backlash destroy.
sentences.chinese: 如有不加顧念者五雷誅滅。

sentences.english: Then God remembered Rachel; he listened to her and opened her womb.
sentences.chinese: 神顧念拉結，應允了她，使她能生育。

sentences.english: As for Lester, he was affectionate and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 雷斯脫呢，對他也是多情的，顧念的。

sentences.english: but that your earnest care for us might be revealed in you in the sightof God.
sentences.chinese: 乃要在神面前把你們顧念我們的熱心表明出來。

sentences.english: Remember that this is a promise to the man who considers the poor.
sentences.chinese: 上帝把這節經文的應許，賜給那些顧念窮人的義人。

sentences.english: For he has looked with favor on the lowliness of his servant.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他顧念他使女的卑微。

definition: to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to say good-bye/to bid sb farewell
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
in fear and trepidation (idiom); in reverence before your majesty (court formula of humility)
